Question: See chapter :ref:`usage/generic:hash checks` for generic checks on hashes
Is the file size 0 bytes? (Probably reset by AV due to a detected infection)
Do the fist bytes contain words in native language - e.g. ``@ECHO OFFECHO "Ãœbertragung``
Do the first 20 bytes already contain executables or command line tools - e.g. ``@echo off net user /domain >``
Is the owner of the file a typical user account - e.g. ``DOM\user123``
Is the owner of the file ``BULTIN\Administrators``
Does the owner string of the file contain ``IIS`` or another service name - e.g. ``IIS_USRS``, ``tomcat``, ``apache``
Does the type match the extension?
Is the type EXE and the extension a benign looking one - e.g. ``.txt`` or ``.pdf``
Does the company string from the PE header match the expected values - e.g. ``cmd.exe`` contains ``Microsoft``
Does the description string from the PE header match the expected values - e.g. ``sapgui.exe`` contains ``SAP GUI for Windows``
Has the file been created very far in the past - e.g. time stamp shows 2021 and older
Has the file been modified on a Sunday (does not apply to regions were admins work on a Sunday for example)
